subject: Design
title: The Macintosh: Making Computers Friendly
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Macintosh: Making Computers Friendly.

hook.text: In 1984, using a computer meant typing cryptic commands. The Macintosh changed that forever.

buildup.text: Apple's team designed a visual interface: folders, trash cans, and a pointer you moved with a mouse.

discovery.text: The key insight was metaphor â€” make the screen look like a desk, and anyone can use it.

twist.text: Steve Jobs obsessed over pixel-level details. Even the calculator app had to look beautiful.

climax.text: The Mac proved that computers aren't just tools â€” they're experiences that need designing.

punchline.text: The best interface is one that needs no manual.

quiz.question: What design principle made the Macintosh intuitive?
